title: Glossary of Health Coverage and Medical Terms
description: This glossary defines many commonly used terms, but isn't a full list. These glossary terms and definitions are intended to be educational and may be different from the terms and definitions in your plan or health insurance policy.
cleaned_text: A marketplace for [health insurance](#health-insurance) where individuals, families and small businesses can learn about their [plan](#plan) options; compare plans based on costs, benefits and other important features; apply for and receive financial help with [premiums](#premium) and [cost sharing](#cost-sharing) based on income; and choose a [plan](#plan) and enroll in coverage. Also known as an "Exchange". The Marketplace is run by the state in some states and by the federal government in others. In some states, the Marketplace also helps eligible consumers enroll in other programs, including Medicaid and the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP). Available online, by
